publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2066 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Regeneration Projects—That the Parliament notes that wholesale housing stock transfer was rejected by 91% of Aberdeen City Council tenants and calls on the Scottish Executive to write off Aberdeen’s council housing debt to allow the city council to invest in regeneration projects in the city’s areas of social exclusion.
S2M-2066 Aberdeen Regeneration Projects (lodged on 24 November 2004) Michael Matheson*

S2M-2066 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Regeneration Projects—That the Parliament notes that wholesale housing stock transfer was rejected by 91% of Aberdeen City Council tenants and calls on the Scottish Executive to write off Aberdeen’s council housing debt to allow the city council to invest in regeneration projects in the city’s areas of social exclusion. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Bruce McFee*, Bruce Crawford*, Alex Neil*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-2066 Aberdeen Regeneration Projects (lodged on 24 November 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*, Richard Lochhead*
S2M-2066 Aberdeen Regeneration Projects (lodged on 24 November 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-2066 Aberdeen Regeneration Projects (lodged on 24 November 2004) Colin Fox*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2066 Aberdeen Regeneration Projects (lodged on 24 November 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2066 Aberdeen Regeneration Projects (lodged on 24 November 2004) Frances Curran*
S2M-2066 Aberdeen Regeneration Projects (lodged on 24 November 2004) Elaine Smith*
